resources.string: Name of the application.\n{{Identical|Wikipedia}}
Name of the beta version of the application.\n{{Identical|Wikipedia Beta}}
Name of the alpha version of the application.
Wikimedia\'s name.\n{{Identical|Wikimedia}}
Hint text for the search box
Hint text for the search box when searching browsing history
Hint text for the search box when searching the set of reading lists
Hint text for the search box when searching for pages in a single reading list
Text in navigation sidebar that when tapped leads to the History screen.\n{{Identical|History}}
Error message shown when network cannot be reached when loading a page
Text for button that retries page loading when tapped.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Text for the back button that goes to the last page visited when tapped.\n{{Identical|Go back}}
Menu item text for clearing your reading history.\n{{Identical|Clear history}}
Message shown when an article is removed from the browsing history. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the article.
%d নিবন্ধগুলি ইতিহাস থেকে সরানো হয়েছে
Button label to undo the operation of deleting an item from the browsing history.\n{{Identical|Undo}}
Button text to take user to app settings screen
Title for dialog box asking if you want to clear your reading history.
Message for the dialog box that asks if the user wants to clear their browsing history, as well close any tabs that are open.
Affirmative answer to clear the browsing history, as well close any tabs that are open.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to clear the browsing history, as well close any tabs that are open.\n{{Identical|No}}

Dialog title text for Share list.

The Share list contains the following menu items (localized):
* Mail
* Message
Label shown when a search result is redirected from the original search query. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the redirect source.
Text hint for the menu button used for showing the list of current tabs.
Menu item for showing list of languages in which this article is available.\n{{Identical|Change language}}
Menu item for invoking Find in page on current page plus the hint text for the Find in page control
Menu item for showing known issues on current page
Menu item for choosing text size and color scheme
Menu item for adding the current page to a reading list.
Menu item text for sharing the currently active page. Uses the build-in Android sharing functionality, so translate it the same way as the operating system does.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Menu item for opening a link in the current tab.\n{{Identical|Open}}
Menu item for opening a link in a new tab.
Menu item for copying a link to the system clipboard for pasting later.
Menu item caption for copying text to the system clipboard for pasting later.\n{{Identical|Copy}}
Menu item caption for launching a dialog containing Wiktionary definitions for the selected text.\n{{Identical|Define}}
Menu item caption for sharing text and images with other apps such as Email and Twitter.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Menu item caption for editing the current section at the currently highlighted word.
Entry in nav drawer for Nearby feature\n{{Identical|Nearby}}
Small toast (popup) message on Nearby screen saying that the current location of the device was not available.
Copyright message with a link to the OpenStreetMap Copyright and License. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form.)
Message in footer of article indicating when the article was last updated. \'%s\' is substituted with the appropriately formatted human-readable timestamp, such as \"seven days ago\".
Link text for accessing Talk pages. Use the same word in your language as is done on the web site. Some use the term discussions.\n{{Identical|Talk}}
Link text for accessing the edit history for the current article.
Link text for viewing the current article on a map (assuming the article has geo coordinates).
Link text that says how many languages the current article is available in. The %d symbol is replaced with the number of languages.
HTML specifying license of the Wiki and link to appropriate CC page. Please preserve the %1$s parameter, since this will be replaced with the actual URL.
HTML specifying Terms of Use and CC license before saving edits. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with the actual URLs.

HTML specifying Terms of Use and CC license and a login link before saving edits, only when the user has not logged in. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with the actual URLs. Also please do not change the href=\'https://#login\' part of the message.
Placeholder text for the textbox that when typed filters list of language wikipedias from which user can pick a language to use.\n{{Identical|Search}}
{{Identical|Search}}
Message shown when the user requested a list of languages in which the current article is available, but the current article is not available in any other language

Message shown when the user requested a list of languages in which the current article is available, and filtered that list using a search, but their search query does not match any of the other languages the article is available in.
Menu item that shows user list of languages the current article is available in.\n{{Identical|Otherlanguages}}
{{Identical|Publish changes}}
Text for progress dialog shown when an edit save is in progress.\n{{Identical|Publishing}}
Small toast (popup) message saying that the edit was successful
Message for dialog box specifying that an edit save had failed
Button text to retry a failed edit save.\n{{Identical|Retry}}
Button text to cancel retrying a failed edit save.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Message for dialog box shown to users when they click on a link in an edit preview, informing them that if they leave the edit then they may lose their changes.
Button text for choosing to leave the edit workflow when the user clicks on a link in preview.\n{{Identical|Leave}}
Button text for choosing to stay inside edit workflow when the user clicks on a link in preview.\n{{Identical|Stay}}
Menu item text for showing the Table of Contents for the current article.\n{{Identical|Table of contents}}
Message shown to user when no search results are found for a string
Message shown when there are no pages in the current reading list that match the specified search term. The %s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Message shown when there are no reading lists whose name matches the specified search term.
Message shown when there are no history entries that match the specified search term.
A label for the CAPTCHA screen.
A call to action to write the CAPTCHA string.
A call to action to write the CAPTCHA string.
Call to action. \"Tap\" is imperative verb, \"touch the touchscreen\".
{{Identical|Log in}}
{{Identical|Username}}
{{Identical|Password}}
Hint for a field where the user can enter a two-factor authentication code, if required.
Message for when login fails during an editing workflow because two-factor authentication is required. Directs the user to return to the main activity, log in, and retry.
{{Identical|Log in}}
Used as window title.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
A bubble that describes the in-progress action.
A bubble that appears after logging in.
{{Identical|Log out}}
Toast popup message notifying the user that they have been logged out.\n{{Identical|Logged out}}
Used in \"Browsing history\" page if there is nothing to show.
Brief explanation that there are currently no History entries to look at. Just to fill an empty screen. This usually happens when a user just deleted history entries.
Brief explanation that there are currently no Search entries to look at. Just to fill an empty screen. This usually happens when a user just deleted search entries.
Menu item hint for deleting selected items in a list.

A stylized string saying \"Wikipedia\". Used before wp_tag_line if no image representation exists. Usually the first and last characters are within big tags, if this fits the Wikipedia logo in your language.
{{Identical|Username}}
Label asking the user if they do not yet have an account.
Button label that lets the user create a new account on Wikipedia.
Label asking the user if they have forgotten their password, and will allow them to reset it.
Label asking the user if they already have an account.
{{Identical|Create account}}
Message shown to the user while a request is sent to the server to create an account and the app is awaiting the server response
Label shown inside the email text box in the account creation form, to inform the user what they have to enter into that box.
{{Identical|Repeat password}}
{{Identical|Passwords do not match}}
Used as an error message on creating a user account where the email address the user entered does not appear to be a valid email address.
Used as an error message on logging in or creating a user account where the username entered does not appear to be valid.
Error shown when the password is not valid.
Used as a generic error message during account creation when a more specific error message cannot be given to the user.
Button text on Create Account screen to go \"next\" (to CAPTCHA).\n{{Identical|Next}}
Button text on Create Account screen to go start creating the account (may also go to a CAPTCHA screen first).\n{{Identical|Create account}}
Preferences general heading.\n{{Identical|General}}
Label for a preferences menu link to the FAQ (frequently asked questions) wiki page for the Wikipedia apps for Android and iOS.
Text for toast connoting that Wikipedia Zero status went to OFF
Lengthy explanation of Wikipedia Zero for settings screen
Link title for the Wikipedia Zero FAQ for the app
Settings heading for Wikipedia Zero.\n{{Identical|Wikipedia Zero}}
Dialog title text to inform Wikipedia Zero user that the user is about to leave the app for an external link
Dialog text to ask Wikipedia Zero user whether the user wants to continue to an external site where standard data charges may apply
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero user to leave the app for an external site where standard data charges may apply.
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero to stay in the app and thereby avoid leaving the app for an external site where standard data charges may apply.\n{{Identical|Stay here}}
Message of a dialog shown the first time Wikipedia Zero mode is On.
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero user to learn more about Wikipedia Zero at the Wikipedia Zero FAQ for the app.\n{{Identical|Learn more}}
Dialog button text for Wikipedia Zero user to dismiss the prompt about visiting the Wikipedia Zero FAQ for the app\n{{Identical|Dismiss}}
Message shown to the user while the user is waiting for the preview of their edit to be shown
Text to show for link used for sending feedback about the app.
Message shown in a small toast when account creation is successful.\n* {{msg-mw|Accountcreatedtext|message}}
Section title for preferences related to syncing and storing user data
Section title for preferences related to syncing
Section title for preferences related to data usage
Section title for experimental settings
Title of preference that, when checked, enables syncing the user\'s reading lists across devices
Title of preference that, when checked, enables syncing the user\'s reading lists across devices from this account
Description of preference that, when checked, enables syncing the user\'s reading lists across devices
Description of preference that, when checked, enables syncing the user\'s reading lists across devices from this account. The %s symbol is replaced with the username if logged in
Title of a warning dialog when turning off the reading list sync. The %s symbol is replaced with the username if logged in
Description of a warning dialog when turning off the reading list sync. The %s symbol is replaced with the username.
Section title for privacy related settings\n{{Identical|Privacy}}
Description of preference that when checked enables data collection of user behavior.
Title of preference that when checked enables automatic upload of crash reports.
Description of preference that when checked checked enables automatic upload of crash reports.
An error message, which appears after trying to save a page with blacklisted links. The single string parameter %s for this message gets substituted with the blocked domain.
Hint for textbox that searches list of items in browsing history as user types.
Message shown in a toast when the app encounters a link it can not process.
Message shown to users when editing a semi-protected page
Message shown to users when editing a fully protected page
Message shown to users when editing a page that is protected with a custom level of protection. %s refers to the name of the protection level. Examples include \'templateeditor\' on enwiki.
Message in dialog box telling the user that their account does not currently have the sufficient rights to edit this page.
Message in dialog box telling the user that this page is currently protected against anonymous editing.
Title of dialog box telling the user that they can not edit this page because it is protected.
Menu item in the nav menu to go to the Settings screen.\n{{Identical|Settings}}
Title at the top of the Settings screen.\n{{Identical|Settings}}
Summary of the preference item to show the About screen.
Summary of the preference item to show the terms of use.\n{{Identical|Privacy policy}}
Summary of the preference item to show the terms of use.\n{{Identical|Terms of use}}

URL leading to the About Wikipedia page. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for German (lang code \"de\"): https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Über_Wikipedia\nPlease test the URL to make sure it works.

URL leading to the Wikimedia Foundation privacy policy. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for German (lang code \"de\"): https://meta.m.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?title=Privacy_policy/de\nPlease test the URL to make sure it works.
URL leading to the Offline reading and data section of Wikimedia Android app FAQ. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so.
URL leading to the page of Wikimedia Android app FAQ. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so.

URL leading to the Wikimedia Foundation terms of use. If you can find the appropriate language specific URL of the mobile site please do so. If not feel free to keep the English one. Example for German (lang code \"de\"): https://m.wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Terms_of_Use/de\nPlease test the URL to make sure it works
URL for details about the Creative Commons CC BY-SA 3.0 license. When possible, please use the appropriate language-specific URL, and the mobile version of the site.
URL for details about the Creative Commons CC0 license. When possible, please use the appropriate language-specific URL, and the mobile version of the site.
Heading for section that lists the libraries that have been used in the app
Heading for section that lists the people who have contributed to the app.\n{{Identical|Contributor}}
Heading for section that gives credit to translatewiki transators.\n{{Identical|Translator}}
Credit given to translatewiki.net translators.\n\n{{doc-important|Please don\'t translate the link and the site title.}}
Heading for section that describes the license for the app itself.\n{{Identical|License}}
Description of the license for the app, as well as links for finding our source code.\n\n {{doc-important|Please don\'t translate links and link titles.}}
Text and link specifying that this app was developed by the Wikimedia Foundation
{{Identical|About}}
Prompt for the user to abandon any changes that were made during editing.
Affirmative answer to abandon any changes that were made during editing.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to abandon any changes that were made during editing.\n{{Identical|No}}
{{Identical|Blocked}}
Message shown in dialog box to users who are blocked from editing when they attempt to save an edit
Message shown in dialog box to users who are blocked from editing based on their IP address
Question that asks the user how they improved the article after editing
Button text to go \"next\" after the editing screen to the preview screen.\n{{Identical|Next}}
Button text to finish editing and save the changes.\n{{Identical|Publish}}
Header text to show above the preview of the edited article.\n{{Identical|Preview}}
Clickable summary tag for fixing a typo
Clickable summary tag for fixing grammar
Clickable summary tag for adding link(s)
Clickable summary tag for a custom/other edit summary text.\n{{Identical|Other}}
Hint (input field placeholder) for the user to write a custom summary of edits
Text for button that finds the next occurrence of a search term.\n{{Identical|Find next}}
Text for button that finds the previous occurrence of a search term
Text that shows up in hint when user tries to get to first occurence when he is already on it.
Text that shows up in hint when user tries to get to last occurence when he is already on it.
Message that warns the user that their edit may be unconstructive, and asks if they want to continue saving it.
Message that informs the user that their edit is not allowed, and that the user must go back and modify the edit.
Explanation of why the edit may be flagged as unconstructive: Typing in all caps, Blanking articles or Spamming, Irrelevant external links or images, Repeating characters
Explanation of why the edit was not allowed: potentially unconstructive, or potential vandalism.
Dialog title for article issues list (issues parsed from hatnote templates, such as \"needs additional citations\").\n{{Identical|Page issue}}
Label for button that shows the Page issues dialog.\n{{Identical|Page issue}}
Label that describes text size selection\n{{Identical|Font size}}
Button label for showing a list of similar titles (disambiguation) for the current page
Label that gives the user a suggestion for a better search term, instead of the one that the user gave. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the suggestion.
Label at the top of the list of recent searches that the user performed.
Button hint for clearing search history; visible when in search mode.
Dialog message that asks if the user really wants to clear the search history.
Affirmative answer to clear the search history.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to clear the search history.\n{{Identical|No}}
Toast message shown when we try to open an external browser but none seems to be installed.
Text shown on the panel which, when tapped, displays the full infobox to the user, therefore exposing a set of information usually composed of factual and short statements.
{{Identical|More information}}
{{Identical|Close}}
Name of the Widget (as seen in the Android widget picker) that displays today\'s featured page.
Text shown inside the widget that tells the user that the link below is today\'s featured page.
Name of the Widget (as seen in the Android widget picker) for searching Wikipedia\n\nFollowed by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification text}}.
Message shown when a user requests a definition from Wiktionary but no definition is found.

Title for notification when new alpha update is available.




Followed by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification text}}.
Text for notification when new alpha update is available.\n\nPreceded by {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-alpha update notification title}}.
Button description for the close image button. The text is mainly for screen readers.\n{{Identical|Close}}

Description of the preference for whether images are loaded, mentioning that this setting should be disabled if the user\'s internet connection is slow, or if their data plan is limited or restricted.
Title of section that contains information specific to the current article.
Menu label for navigating to the File page for the current image being shown in the gallery.
Error message shown when the current image could not be displayed.
Title for activity displaying the license text for a library that we use. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the library for which the license is being shown.
Label for menu item to share the current image.\n{{Identical|Share}}
Error message shown when there was a problem with sharing the image. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the actual error message from the system.
Message shown when the current media item is being downloaded.
Mesajo montrata pos sucesoza kopiado di la nun arkivo en la lokala aparato (komputero, posh-telefonilo, \'tablet\'...).
Error message displayed when a video fails to be played on the device.
Message shown to explain that an extra write permission is needed to save an image.
Error message when we detect that a file cannot be written to storage.

Intro text included as part of the shared text snippet, aka Tweet-a-fact. Please do not translate the \"@Wikipedia\" in the message and preserve the spaces around it, as it refers specifically to Wikipedia\'s Twitter account. This message has two parameters. Please keep the parameters exactly as in the original English message.\n* %1$s is the title of the page the text snippet is from.\n* %2$s is an HTML link to the page.
Title for a button that, when clicked, will expand the list of references or notes at the bottom of a page.
Button on share snippet preview to share as image card.
Button on share snippet preview to share as plain text.
Content description for the share a fact preview image. This string is only used for screen readers.
Content description of Creative Commons license logo icon shown before an edit is submitted.
Content description of the actual captcha image the user has to recognize to proceed.
Short name of the Fair Use license when applied to media that do not have attribution information.\n{{Identical|Fair use}}
Text displayed when the uploader of a media item is not known.
Text hint for the menu button used for creating a new tab.
Text hint for the menu button used for closing all tabs.
Confirmation message shown when closing all tabs.
Affirmative answer to closing all tabs.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to closing all tabs.\n{{Identical|No}}
Text hint for the button used for closing a tab.
Title for tool-tip that introduces the user to highlighting text in the article.
Very short advice on how to highlight text for copying to the clipboard or sharing.
Very short advice on sharing highlighted text on social networks.
Text for a link that will open the current page in an external browser app on the device.
Advice on accessing the table of contents for a page.\n\n\'\'\'In right-to-left languages\'\'\' (Hebrew, Arabic, etc.) write \'\'\'left\'\'\' edge and not \"right\".
Generic error message that tells the user that the response from the server was not formatted correctly.
Generic error message that tells the user that an unknown error occurred.
Message displayed to the user that shows the actual error response received from the server. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the API onThisDay from the server.\n{{Identical|Message}}
Message shown after copying a link to the system clipboard.
Message shown after copying text to the system clipboard.
Button to continue to the full article from the current link preview.
Button text for adding the current page to a reading list.
Message informing the user that an article cannot be loaded while the app is offline. This message is followed by page_offline_notice_add_to_reading_list.

Message inviting the user to add the requested article to a reading list to be downloaded when the app is online. This message follows {{msg-wm|Wikipedia-android-strings-page_offline_notice_cannot_load_while_offline}}.
Message that tells the user that the current article is loaded from offline storage. The %s symbol is replaced with the date when the article was saved.

Message that tells the user that the current article is loaded from a downloaded offline compilation. The %1$s symbol is replaced with the name of the article pack containing the article, and the %2$s symbol is replaced with the date when the compilation was downloaded.
Button to obtain directions to the location specified in the link preview.
Error displayed when the device does not have any apps installed that are capable of providing directions to a location.
Description of the preference for enabling or disabling link previews.
Text in navigation sidebar that when tapped leads to a web page where the user may donate to Wikipedia.
Error displayed when the device does not support voice recognition.
Message shown when trying to use location services but they are unavailable
Button label for enabling location services\n{{Identical|Enable}}
Message shown informing the user that if they enable the Location permission, they will be able to see places nearby.
Button label for requesting to turn on location permissions.
Error informing the user that the System WebView is being updated, meaning that the app cannot be launched right now, and that the user should try again in a moment.
Toolbar title shown when the user is selecting multiple items in a list. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of items currently selected.
Generic message informing the user that an error occurred
Button label for a button to dismiss a link preview\n{{Identical|Dismiss}}
Error message informing the user that the requested page does not exist
{{Doc-mobileapp-internet}}\nError message shown when network cannot be reached when loading a page
Title shown on the popup dialog for a reference clicked by the user. The %s symbol is replaced with the link text of the clicked reference.
Label for a switch on the theme chooser dialog allowing the user to toggle whether images are dimmed in the Dark theme
Title for a preference allowing the user to prefer using cached content over getting the freshest content from the network
Summary for a preference allowing the user to prefer using cached content over getting the freshest content from the network
Title for a preference to enable the Offline Library feature.
Summary for a preference to enable the Offline Library feature, with a link to a Wiki page that explains more about the feature.
Title of the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, asking user to send a report
Text asking the user to send us a crash report
In the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, text for button that doesn\'t send a crash report.\n{{Identical|Skip}}
In the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, text for button that prevents the pop up from being shown again and always sends a crash report.
In the dialog that pops up when the app crashes, text for button that sends a crash report once.\n{{Identical|Send}}
Title of the retry screen displayed when the app crashes.
Message shown to user when the app crashes allowing them to relaunch or quit the app.
Title of button user presses to relaunch the app after it crashes.
Title of button user presses to quit the app after it crashes.\n{{Identical|Quit}}
Describes the action performed when pressing the bookmark button in the page toolbar underneath the leading image.
Describes the action performed when pressing the share button in the page toolbar underneath the leading image.
Button hint for editing either the lead section or the description of the article.\n{{Identical|Edit}}
Menu label for editing the description of the article.
Menu label for editing the first section of the article.
Label that describes color theme selection\n{{Identical|Theme}}
Button label for Light color theme\n{{Identical|Light}}
Button label for Dark color theme\n{{Identical|Dark}}
Button label for Black color theme\n{{Identical|Black}}
An example header title for previewing color theme changes.
Sample descriptive text giving the user instructions on using the text size slider.
Title for a preference allowing the user to change the color theme of the app
Description for a preference allowing the user to turn on the dark theme
Button hint for increasing the text size used in articles.
Button hint for decreasing the text size used in articles.
Label indicating that the current text size is the default size. The %s symbol is replaced with the percentage of the size.
Navigation menu item label for reading lists.
Name for a reading list that has an empty title.\n{{Identical|Untitled}}
Menu item label for saving the current article to a reading list.
Dialog title for creating a new reading list.
Error text shown when a user attempts to create a new list with the same title as an existing list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the title of the existing list.
An error message shown to the user when the user attempts to create a reading list with an empty title.
Message shown when an article is added to a reading list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Message shown when an article already exists in the selected reading list.
Button label to view the reading list to which the article was just added.
Summary shown for a reading list that contains one article (singular); this string is formatted with a parameter containing the number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.

Summary shown for a reading list that contains zero or multiple articles (plural); this string is formatted with two arguments: 1) the number of pages in the list, 2) a parameter containing the total number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.

Detailed description shown for a reading list that contains one article (singular); this string is formatted with two arguments: 1) the number, zero or one, of pages saved to disk for offline reading, 2) a parameter containing the number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.

Detailed description shown for a reading list that contains zero or multiple articles (plural); this string is formatted with three arguments: 1) the number of pages saved to disk for offline reading, 2) the number of pages in the list total, 3) a parameter containing the total number of megabytes saved to disk for offline page reading.
Button label to sort reading lists.\n{{Identical|Sort}}
Menu option to sort reading lists by name.
Menu option to sort reading lists by name, in reverse order.
Menu option to sort reading lists from newest to oldest, based on the date the items were added.
Menu option to sort reading lists from oldest to newest, based on the date the items were added.
Menu option to sort reading lists from newest to oldest, based on the date the items were created.
Menu option to sort reading lists from oldest to newest, based on the date the items were created.
Button label to delete the current reading list.
Menu item for changing the name of a reading list.\n{{Identical|Rename}}
Menu item for changing the description of a reading list.
Label for a menu option allowing the user to remove selected articles from offline storage
Label for a menu option allowing the user to save article content for offline availability
Label for a menu option allowing the user to remove all articles in a reading list from offline storage
Label for a menu option allowing the user to save all articles in a reading list for offline availability
Label for a menu option allowing the user to add the selected articles to another reading list
Default name for a new reading list.
Text input hint for entering the name of this reading list.
Text input hint for entering a description of this reading list. Mention that the description is optional.
Message shown when an article is removed from a reading list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the article.
Message shown when multiple articles are removed from a reading list. The \"%d\" symbol is replaced with the number of articles removed.
Button label to undo the operation of deleting an item from a list.\n{{Identical|Undo}}
Message shown when a reading list is deleted. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the list.
Title message shown when there are no articles in saved list.
Descriptive message that explains the benefits of reading lists, and the location of the button to add an article to a reading list.
Short introductory statement about reading lists to be shown in the onboarding screen, emphasizing that reading lists are available for offline access.
Label stating that the items below are examples of reading list titles.
First example of a reading list title, in this case places to visit.
Second example of a reading list title, in this case favorite animals.
Third example of a reading list title, in this case space (as in outer space, cosmos).
Label for the button that dismisses an introductory dialog that tells the user about the new Reading Lists feature.
Text to show when the reading list does not have a description.
Message shown when a reading list does not contain any articles.
Label for a toggle switch to make a reading list article available offline or online.
Hint for button that makes a reading list article available for offline use.
Menu item to add an article to another reading list (when the article already exists in one or more lists).
Menu item to remove an article from a specific reading list. The %s symbol is replaced with the name of the reading list.
Menu item to remove an article from multiple reading lists to which it might belong.
Label for a dialog button confirming that the user wants to remove the selected list from offline availability for all reading lists.
Title for a dialog warning the user that the page the user has selected to remove from offline availability appears in multiple lists.

Message for a dialog warning the user that the page the user has selected to remove from offline availability appears in multiple lists. The names of the lists appear below. The \"%s\" symbol is the title of the page of the user selected to remove.
Title for a tutorial card that reminds the user that their reading lists can be synchronized.
Text for a tutorial card that reminds the user that their reading lists can be synchronized, with a link to the synced reading lists FAQ page that explains the procedure in detail.
Button text for turning on synchronizing of reading lists.
Title for a tutorial card that reminds the user that logging in will enable syncing of reading lists.
Text for a tutorial card that reminds the user that logging in will enable syncing of reading lists.
Warning message shown to a user to confirm that remotely stored reading list data used for syncing across devices should be deleted.
Affirmative answer to confirm that remotely stored reading list data used for syncing across devices should be deleted.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to confirm that remotely stored reading list data used for syncing across devices should be deleted.\n{{Identical|No}}
Message shown when the article is in the process of being downloaded, and is not yet available for offline access.
Message shown to the user when the user tries to add pages to a reading list but the list already contains all of the chosen pages.
Message shown when the user adds articles to a named reading list. The %1$d symbol is replaced with the number of articles added, and the %2$s symbol is replaced with the list name.
Confirmation message shown when deleting a reading list. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the name of the list.
Title of warning message shown to a user to login for enabling syncing of reading lists.
Warning message shown to a user to login for enabling syncing of reading lists.
Negative answer to cancel the current process.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Affirmative answer to confirm and redirect to the login page.\n{{Identical|Log in}}
Title of warning message shown to a user when the user turns OFF syncing on one of their devices.
Warning message shown to a user when the user turns OFF syncing on one of their devices.
Negative answer to dismiss the dialog.\n{{Identical|OK}}
Affirmative answer to confirm and redirect to the settings page.\n{{Identical|Settings}}
Title of warning message shown to a user who is logged in who has not opted-in to syncing enters this screen at the first time.

Warning message shown to a user who is logged in who has not opted-in to syncing enters this screen at the first time, also contains a link to mediawiki FAQ page. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form.)
An option shows on dialog that does not allow to receive the message again.
Affirmative answer to confirm and redirect to the settings page.
Negative answer to dismiss the dialog.\n{{Identical|No thanks}}
Title of warning message shown to a user to merge or delete the local reading lists articles with the synced reading lists after the user logs in
Warning message shown to a user to merge or delete the local reading lists articles with the synced reading list after the user logs in
>Affirmative answer to add the local reading lists articles with the other synced reading lists
Negative answer to confirm that removes reading lists from device
Title of warning message shown to a user to keep articles after the user logs out
Warning message shown to a user to keep articles after the user logs out
>Affirmative answer to confirm that keeps articles from device
Negative answer to confirm that removes articles from device
Title for default list
Short description of the default reading list where articles are saved.
Suggestion string for users to Organize articles into lists
Text explaining the advantages of creating reading lists, to users
\"%1$s\" _[string indicating that the list was created by user]

Message shown to users with large reading lists, informing them that this update will enforce a limit on the number of articles per list and hence will be splitting already existing lists that contain more than the limit. The %d symbol is replaced with the maximum number of articles per list.

Message shown to the users when the limit for maximum number of articles in a list is reached, denoted by the \"%2$d\" symbol, informing them that they will not be able to add anymore to that list, named \"%1$s\".
Message shown to the users when the limit for maimum number of reading lists is reached, informing them that they will not be able to create anymore lists
User education message suggesting the users to log in to reap the benefits of synced reading lists

plurals.name: reading_list_article_offline_message
plurals.item: Message shown when a single reading list article is made available for offline use.
Message shown when more than one reading list article is made available for offline use.

plurals.name: reading_list_article_not_offline_message
plurals.item: Message shown when a single reading list article is removed from offline availability.
Message shown when more than one reading list article is removed from offline availability.

resources.string: Checkbox title for Wikimedia account preference synchronization.\n{{Identical|Preferences}}
Button label for navigating to the talk page of the user who is the agent of the notification.
Title for notification when the user receives a new message on their Talk page.

Text of notification when the user receives a new message on their Talk page. The \"%1$s\" symbol corresponds to the user who left the message, and the \"%2$s\" symbol is the title of the talk page of the user.
Title for notification when an edit made by the user is reverted.
Text of notification when an edit made by the user is reverted. The \"%1$s\" symbol corresponds to the user who reverted the edit, and the \"%2$s\" symbol is the title of the page that was edited.
Title for notification when the user receives a Thanks from another user.

Text of notification when the user receives a Thanks from another user. The \"%1$s\" symbol corresponds to the user who sent the thanks, and the \"%2$s\" symbol is the title of the page for which the user was thanked.
Name of the notification channel
Description of the notification channel
Title for notification when the syncing process begins. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of articles.
Text of notification shows the remaining articles. The \"%1$d\" symbol corresponds to the amount of remaining articles.
Text of button on notification bar to pause the syncing process\n{{Identical|Pause}}
Text of button on notification bar to resume the syncing process
Text of button on notification bar to cancel the syncing process\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Label for card in the feed that reminds the user to continue reading an article from their browsing history.
Label for card in the feed that gives the user reading suggestions based on an article from their browsing history.
Title of a card that the user can click to view a randomly selected Wikipedia article
Message inviting the user to view a randomly selected Wikipedia article.
Buttol label for navigating to the screen where random articles are shown.
Button hint for loading another random article.
Title of a card that the user can click to view the main page of the Wikipedia project for the current app language.
Message indicating that the user will be shown the project\'s main page for the current date. The \"%s\" symbol is replaced with the current date.
Button label for navigating to the Main Page of Wikipedia.
Title of a card showing the Picture of the Day from Wikimedia Commons.
Label for a button the user can click to download the full-size Picture of the Day.\n{{Identical|Download}}
Menu item used for hiding a certain item in the list of feed cards.
Message to inform the user that the selected item has been hidden.
Label for toolbar menu item that shows the user more options, such as logging in and accessing the app settings.
Text included as the subject when a user shares an image from the Today\'s Featured Image feed card.
Menu item label for exploring Wikipedia content through Feed cards.\n{{Identical|Explore}}
Feed card title for recently popular articles.\n{{Identical|Trending}}
Feed card icon description for use when the icon cannot be seen and acessibility.
Feed card title for news articles.

plurals.name: view_continue_reading_card_subtitle
plurals.item: Subtitle for a day old \"continue reading\" card. The word should be in lowercase if appropriate for the language.

Subtitle for a \"continue reading\" card two or more days old. The first word should have an initial uppercase letter if appropriate for the language. Example: [[phab:F4695814]]. Use the %d parameter to insert the number of days passed since the content (an article) was last seen.

resources.string: Shown on cards in the feed when the card has today\'s date. The word should be in lowercase if appropriate for the language.\n{{Identical|Today}}

Subtitle for number of days passed since the article was last seen and shown on cards in the feed. Use the %s parameter to insert the number of days passed since the content (an article) was last seen. The word \"read\" is past tense.
Button label that allows the user to decline the action that this card is requesting.\n{{Identical|No thanks}}
Message in the feed informing the user that additional content cannot be loaded while offline.
Title shown in the Featured Article card in the Explore feed\n{{Identical|Featured article}}
Button label for saving the current featured article to a reading list, if it is not already saved.\n{{Identical|Save}}
Button label for when the current featured article is already saved to a reading list, but may now be removed from the list, or saved to a different list.\n{{Identical|Saved}}
Title shown at the top of the screen where the user customizes which cards are shown in the Explore feed.
Menu label for resetting the customization of the Explore feed cards to the original defaults.
Menu label for selecting all types of Explore feed cards to be shown.\n{{Identical|Select all}}
Menu label for deselecting all types of Explore feed cards from being shown.
Short description for Explore feed card that contains daily news items
Short description for Explore feed card that contains events that occurred on this day in history
Short description for Explore feed card that contains a link to previous article(s) read by the user
Short description for Explore feed card that contains suggestions based on the browsing history of the user
Short description for Explore feed card that contains the daily featured article
Short description for Explore feed card that contains daily trending articles
Short description for Explore feed card that contains the daily featured image from Commons
Short description for Explore feed card that contains a link to the Main Page
Short description for Explore feed card that generates random articles
Button label for onboarding card that introduces the customization of the Explore feed.
Onboarding text that describes the new functionality of customizing the Explore feed.
Hint text that is shown when the description field is empty.
Hint for the button that is pressed for saving the new description.\n{{Identical|Publish}}
Label that prompts the user to add a description to an article that does not yet have one.
Label that prompts the user to edit the description of an article that already has one.
Hint for button that cancels editing of the current description.\n{{Identical|Cancel}}
Title at the top of the screen that shows additional help and information about editing descriptions.
Menu label for navigating to a page describing Wikidata.
Menu label for navigating to the official Wikidata guide for composing descriptions.
URL that points to an introduction page about Wikidata in this language.
URL that points to a page on Wikidata that contains guidelines for writing descriptions. Preferably the URL should link directly to the section that lists specific guidelines.
Dialog message that informs the user that they must log in before making edits to additional descriptions.
Disclaimer that specifies the Terms of Use and CC license that applies to editing descriptions. Please preserve the %1$s and %2$s parameters, since these will be replaced with URLs.
Message that the description the user just added was saved.
Message that the user made Wikipedia better for everyone
Button text to dismiss the description editing success screen\n{{Identical|Done}}
Heading for a tip about editing articles in the app\n{{Identical|Did you know}}
A message informing the user about how to edit articles in the app. The \"^1\" symbol is replaced with an edit pencil icon.
Heading for a tutorial about editing page title descriptions.
Summary of what page title descriptions are for.
An instruction for the user to keep descriptions short.
Instructions for the description the user creates to be one line only and between two to twelve words.
Label for a button the user can push when ready to start editing.
A statement that the user promises not to misuse the feature.
Heading for a dialog window that provides detailed information about Wikidata descriptions.\n{{Identical|About}}
Informative message that summarizes the purpose of descriptions.
Heading for a list of tips for creating effective descriptions.

A quick overview of some guidelines for creating descriptions. These can be adapted to your language; for example, if your language doesn\'t have small and capital letters, you don\'t have to mention it.
Heading for a list of example descriptions.
An example description of a notable work of art, music, or literature.
Title description for the article mentioned in {{msg-wikimedia|Wikipedia-android-strings-description edit help tips example1\"}}
An example description of a notable landmark or geological feature. Like all Wikdata descriptions, it \'\'mustn\'t start with a capital\'\' unless if the first word requires it.
Title description for the article mentioned in {{msg-wikimedia|Wikipedia-android-strings-description edit help tips example2\"}}
Heading for further information about descriptions.\n{{Identical|More information}}
Meta information about Wikidata descriptions and their role in Wikimedia Foundation projects.
Subtitle in the dialog that informs the user that their edit was reverted.
Introduction message informing the user that their edit was reverted, and leading into possible reasons for the revert.
Reason for an edit being reverted, because it did not follow the guidelines for descriptions. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Reason for an edit being reverted, because it looks like vandalism.
Message that allows the user to go to the edit history associated with the article. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Message shown when the user attempts to download an article pack but the device is offline.
Message explaining why we need permission to access the device storage when reading articles in offline mode.
Message explaining why we need permission to access the device storage when reading articles in offline mode.
Error shown when the app could not read from the internal or external storage of the device due to permission not being granted.
Message shown in the Feed card that informs the user that they are now browsing Wikipedia from article packs in offline mode.
Button label for the user to navigate to the offline library screen.
Title shown on the toolbar of the activity for managing article packs.
Menu item for searching article packs by name.
Label that states how many article packs the user has available in the Offline Library. The %d symbol is replaced with the number of article packs detected.
Button text for adding an offline article pack to the Offline Library.
Title shown on the toolbar of the activity that shows all downloadable article packs.
{{Doc-mobileapp-internet}}\nShort description of the Offline Library.
Information about the date and size of an article pack. The %1$s and %2$s symbols will be replaced with the date and size.
Label for showing size in GB. The %.2f is replaced by the number in gigabytes(GB)
Label for showing size in MB. The %.2f is replaced by the number in megabytes (MB)
Label for a button for downloading an offline article pack. The %s symbol is replaced with the article pack size, in either megabytes (MB) or gigabytes (GB).
Label for a button for removing an offline article pack from storage on the user\'s device.
Menu label for downloading a selected article pack.
Label that says how much free space is available on the device. The %s symbol is replaced with the size in either megabytes(MB) or gigabytes(GB).
Label that appears next to the number of gigabytes used by all the downloaded packs in the user\'s Offline Library.
Legend label for the amount of space used by other applications on the device.

Information about an offline article pack download in progress. The %1$s symbol represents the size downloaded till now (in either MB or GB) and the %2$s symbol represents the total size of the file (in either GB or MB).

plurals.name: offline_compilation_download_time_remaining
plurals.item: Message shown when an offline article pack has an estimated one minute remaining before the download is finished.
Message shown when an offline article pack has an estimated two or more minutes remaining before the download is finished.

resources.string: Accessibility hint text for a button to cancel an article pack download
Confirmation message asking if the user really wants to cancel the download.
Affirmative answer to cancel the download.\n{{Identical|Yes}}
Negative answer to cancel the download.\n{{Identical|No}}
Menu label for sharing the selected article pack through another app.
Menu label for removing the selected article pack from the device.
Confirmation message asking if the user really wants to remove the selected article pack from the device.
Title shown at the top of the activity for managing the offline library.
Message shown when the offline library is empty.
Quick description of the benefits of offline article packs, with a link to a MediaWiki page with further details about the feature.
Hint informing the user that article packs remain available for browsing offline, with a link to a MediaWiki page with further details about the feature.
Button label for searching the list of possible article packs to download.
Label informing the user that the current search results are from one or more offline article packs.
Label for a button for the user to confirm that the user is done with the tutorial for the Offline Library.\n{{Identical|Done}}
Title for a tutorial screen about the Offline Library feature.
Short explanatory text about the Offline Library feature.
Title for a tutorial screen about the Offline Library feature.
{{Doc-mobileapp-internet}}\nShort explanatory text about the Offline Library feature.
Title for a tutorial screen about the Offline Library feature.
Short explanatory text about the Offline Library feature.
Message to be shown at the top of Main Pages of offline article packs, providing additional guidance to the user about usage of the Main Page.
Button label to skip the current onboarding or tutorial screen.\n{{Identical|Skip}}
Button label to continue to the next onboarding or tutorial screen.\n{{Identical|Continue}}
Button label to finish the current onboarding or tutorial workflow.\n{{Identical|Get started}}
Title for a tutorial screen about the general introducing to Wikipedia.
General introduction about the Wikipedia. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Title for a tutorial screen about the Explore feed.
Short explanatory text about the benefits of the Explore feed.
Title for a tutorial screen about saving articles to reading lists.
Short explanatory text about the benefits of saving articles to reading lists. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Title for a tutorial screen about synchronizing reading lists.
Short explanatory text about the benefits of synchronizing reading lists. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Short explanatory text about the benefits of synchronizing reading lists. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Title for a tutorial screen about anonymous usage reports sent by the app.
Short explanatory text about the benefits of allowing the app to send anonymous usage reports. (Please preserve the anchor tag in its exact form)
Label for an on-off switch that enables sending anonymous usage reports.
Short explanation of the benefits of creating an account, which is the ability to synchronize your reading lists.
Short explanation of the benefits of creating an account, which is the ability to keep a record of your edits.
Short explanation of the benefits of creating an account, which is the ability to save your preferences.
Button label for dismissing the current onboarding card.\n{{Identical|Got it}}
A shortcut icon on the home screen for getting a random article.\n{{Identical|Random}}
A shortcut icon on the home screen for continuing reading an article.
A shortcut icon on the home screen for opening the search page.\n{{Identical|Search}}
Button label to navigate to a full-screen view containing more trending articles.
Title for the screen with all trending links. \"%1$s\" represents the date string
Title for the card that shows historic events of a particular day.
Suggestion text for the user indicating that there are more events for the date.

Label indicating the number of events that occurred in a certain range of years. The \"%1$s\" symbol is replaced with the number of events, \"%2$s\" is the beginning year, and \"%3$d\" is the ending year
Text to say, \'This year\'
Button label for scrolling the content to the top.

plurals.name: diff_years
plurals.item: Text indicating that the event occured one year ago.
Text indicating that the event occured two or more years ago.\"%d\" is the number of years.
